reference.title: Viewing internal settings
reference.shortdesc: Internal settings change cluster behavior and are used for Couchbase use only.

section.p: These internal settings change cluster behavior, performance, and timing and are exposed only via the REST API. The /internalSettings parameters are implemented on the server level.
section.note: These settings are for internal Couchbase use only and are not supported for public use.
The Maximum Parallel Indexer setting can also be implemented on the global level via /settings/maxParallelIndexers globalValue.

row.entry: Retrieves the global and node-specific parallel indexer configuration.
Sets and retrieves the new global and node-specific parallel indexer configuration. Value range: 1 to 1024. Default: 4

section.title: Response codes
section.codeblock: HTTP/1.1 200 OK HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error

reference.title: Setting maximum parallel indexers
reference.shortdesc: Couchbase internal settings for the maximum parallel indexers are retrieved and changed with the GET and POST /settings/maxParallelIndexers HTTP methods and URI.

section.title: HTTP method and URI
section.p: To set the Maximum Parallel Indexer parameter on the global level, use the /settings/maxParallelIndexers URI and globalValue parameter. The value range is 1 to 1024. Default: 4. The results provide the global and node-specific parallel indexer configuration.

section.title: Syntax
Example: POST
section.p: To change the setting, use the POST method with the /settings/maxParallelIndexers URI and globalValue parameter. Value range: 1 to 1024. Default: 4.
